data.prayer: Lord, please give the 23,190 believers in the state of Kangwŏn-do the Spirit of wisdom and revelation, so that they might know you better.
data.verse: I keep asking that the God of our Lord Jesus Christ, the glorious Father, may give you the Spirit of wisdom and revelation, so that you may know him better.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Kangwŏn-do, North Korea
data.section_summary: What people or activities could you pray for in this photo?

data.prayer: Spirit, give the disciples of the the state of Kangwŏn-do words, actions, signs and wonders to proclaim the coming of the Kingdom.
data.verse: As you go, proclaim this message: "The kingdom of heaven has come near."

data.prayer: Father, let the threatened of Kangwŏn-do, North Korea know that it is better to trust in you than to trust in humans.
data.verse: It is better to take refuge in the Lord than to trust in humans.

data.prayer: Father, you know every soul, and you know who are yours and who are yet to be yours out of the 1,477,600 people living in Kangwŏn-do, North Korea. Please, call your lost sheep to yourself.
data.verse: For I will take you out of the nations; I will gather you from all the countries and bring you back into your own land.

data.prayer: Father, 1.2% are known to be believers. Please, Lord call more today.
Father, we pray that the people of Kangwŏn-do, North Korea will learn to study the Bible, understand it, obey it, and share it.
Lord, use Google search to lead people in Kangwŏn-do, North Korea to the gospel today.

data.section_summary:
the state of Kangwŏn-do, North Korea has a population of 1,477,600.

We estimate Kangwŏn-do has 23,190 people who might know Jesus, 1,298 people who might know about Jesus culturally, and 1,453,112 people who do not know Jesus.

This is 1 believer for every 63 neighbors who need Jesus.

data.prayer: God, we ask you to raise up elders and deacons from the 23,190 believers in Kangwŏn-do, who will serve the church and equip it to do your work.
data.verse: So Christ himself gave the apostles, the prophets, the evangelists, the pastors and teachers, to equip his people for works of service, so that the body of Christ may be built up until we all reach unity in the faith and in the knowledge of the Son of God and become mature, attaining to the whole measure of the fullness of Christ.
